page.title: 07DISABLED RIDING,WASHINGTON
page.content: {STRANG RIDING CENTRE}-opened in 1977, this is a registered charity which caters for both the {mentally and physically handicapped, teaching them to ride for both pleasure and exercise. Riding helps disabled people as it assists circulation, co-ordination and strengthens their muscles. About 20 riders can be catered for at one time. These people come from{Tyne & Wear, {Durham and Northumberland.} Depending on the degree of disability, up to 3 helpers per disabled person may be needed. Every year at least{Â£15,000 is needed to run the centre. Most of this has to be raised, but it is partly financed by the{Manpower {Services Commission. }25% of the staff come from the M.S.C. but the rest are volunteers. There is also a bridleway on which the riders can practise.
